snp5.7:2.3: This is an abbreviated form of the phrase _natthi kiñcī’ti_ that normally marks the dimension of nothingness.
snp5.7:2.4: Niddesa explains _kathāhi_ as either “doubts” (hence a truncated form of _kathaṅkathā_), or “talks”; the former is followed by Bodhi, the latter by Norman and Ñāṇadīpa. While “doubts” seems contextually more likely, elsewhere _(paṭi)virato_ is commonly used with speech and never, to my knowledge, with doubt.
snp5.7:6.3: Compare the stock idiom _Saṅkhampi na upeti upanidhimpi na upeti kalabhāgampi na upeti_ at eg. sn20.2:1.7; also snp1.12:3.4.
